titleInfo.title: Grand Army of the Republic Monument

mods.abstract: The first Grand Army of the Republic monument was erected in the northeast corner of Knoxville's National Cemetery in 1901. This memorial featured a column of Tennessee marble topped by a statue of a Union soldier and a bronze eagle with his wings spread. This monument was struck by lightning and destroyed on August 22, 1904. Its replacement, shown here, was completed on October 15, 1906. It features a miniature medieval fortress and a central column topped with a statue of a Union soldier at parade rest. A contemporary local legend identifies him as General John T. Wilder, who was the only ranking general on the memorial committee.
